Class Connection

java.lang.Object
mygame.multiplayer.services.Connection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service
public final class Connection extends Object implements Service
A Connection is the way the server and clients signal to each other that they are still active.

This is so that, for example, if the server crashes, the clients should disconnect; or when a player abandons the game, the other player should win.

To maintain a Connection, the connector repeatedly (see Scheduler.repeat(java.lang.Runnable)) writes to a designated file, constantly changing its content. Other parties monitor this file (see Connection.ConnectionMonitor); if it stops changing, it means that party has disconnected.

  • Constructor Details

    • Connection

      public Connection(Path connectionPath)
      Starts a connection.
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • allowInterrupt

      public PublisherService<String> allowInterrupt()
      Allows the connection to be interrupted by an external process.

      This watches for the creation of an interrupt file in the parent directory of the connection file; when it's created, stops the connection.

      Returns:
      a PublisherService that triggers when the connection is interrupted

    • isActive

      public static boolean isActive(Path filePath)
      Check whether a connection is active at the moment. Blocks the current thread to do the checking.

      It does so by reading the connection file, wait for the scheduler's clock period plus a bit of buffer time, and then read the file again. The connection is active if and only if the file content has changed.

      Parameters:
      filePath - the connection file
      Returns:
      whether it's active

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Description copied from interface: Service
      Stops the service.
      Specified by:
      stop in interface Service
